alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Osceola County through 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holopaw, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holopaw, Forever Florida and Deer Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
